feed.title: ShinyTracker
feed.subtitle: Lists and displays detected changes on the RSI "Progress Tracker"

entry.title: Progress Tracker Delta - 2022-06-08
entry.content:
Progress Tracker Delta

459 deliverables listed | 2022-05-25 => 2022-06-08

There were 53 modifications, 2 removals, and 6 additions in this update. Please note that not all removals are intentional; there is currently a bug with how time is entered on the Progress Tracker that can cause deliverables to disappear.

extra analysis (click me)


There are approximately 459 devs (out of ~512, or 90%) with 993 assignments scheduled to work on 137 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 5% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~183 devs (36%) scheduled for approximately 2384 man-days. 9% of deliverables are shared between both projects.

On average, the schedule has expanded by 29 days. 9 deliverables were not extended:
  • AI - Navigation Links - Ladders/Ledge Grab
  • Chapter 08
  • ECUS Improvements
  • Hospital Surgeon
  • Personal Inventory
  • Replication Layer Entity Authority
  • Stanton Fashion Clothing
  • Underwater Rendering/Caustics
  • VisArea Improvements

[2] deliverable(s) removed:

Mission Manager App

Last scheduled from 2022-05-08 to 2022-08-25
Alongside converting to Building Blocks, this feature includes an updated UI in support of the dynamic mission system. Also includes the ability for players to see the reputational requirements of mission content.

The following team(s) have been freed up:

  • US PU Gameplay Feature Team
    x1 Art dev had 6 tasks

Room Depressurization

Last scheduled from 2022-07-07 to 2022-12-20
Creating the ability for players to increase or decrease the atmospheric pressure in a defined/closed room.

The following team(s) have been freed up:

  • EU PU Gameplay Feature Team
    x1 Engineering dev had 50 tasks

[6] deliverable(s) added:

Aegis Retaliator Base

2023-01-01 => 2023-03-16
Building, implementing, and balancing the base variant of Aegis multi-crew combat ship, the Retaliator, as a game-ready vehicle.

The following team(s) were assigned:

  • Vehicle Content - EU will begin work 2023-01-01
    x1 Design dev with 11 tasks (208% load)
    x1 Art dev with 3 tasks (417% load)

Anvil Crucible

2023-02-19 => 2023-03-16
Building, implementing, and balancing Anvil’s ship repair platform, the Crucible, as a game-ready vehicle.

The following team(s) were assigned:

  • Vehicle Content - EU will begin work 2023-02-19
    x1 Design dev with 4 tasks (417% load)
    x4 Art devs with 12 tasks (104% load)

Freight Elevators

2022-09-25 => 2023-03-01
Implementation of systems and content for players to physically load and unload cargo to and from their ships by conveying cargo to and from hangars, landing pads, garages, and docking collars.

The following team(s) were assigned:

  • US PU Gameplay Feature Team will begin work 2022-09-25
    x2 Engineering devs with 16 tasks (52% load)
    x2 Design devs with 12 tasks (44% load)

New Player Experience

2022-07-07 => 2022-11-08
An initiative for improving the initial (first 30 minutes) gameplay experience, which will help players understand the context of the world and introduce them to some of Star Citizen’s basic features. This will include updates to landing zones, spaceports, habs, shops, and more.

The following team(s) were assigned:

  • EU Landing Zone Team will begin work 2022-07-07
    x2 Art devs with 5 tasks (64% load)

Player/Machine Physical Interaction

2022-09-29 => 2022-12-30
Initial implementation of animations that show the player interacting with ship controls and items. Includes pushing buttons, flicking switches, and interacting with other areas of the cockpit. Also includes other machines and items, including locker doors.

The following team(s) were assigned:

  • Actor Feature Team will begin work 2022-09-29
    x2 Animation devs with 12 tasks (57% load)
    x1 Engineering dev with 6 tasks (115% load)

Salvage - Vehicle Munching

2022-09-29 => 2023-03-28
Implementing the ability to transform large chunks of metal salvaged from ships into a refinable material. This will use the grinder systems aboard salvage ships like the Vulture and Reclaimer.

The following team(s) were assigned:

  • EU PU Gameplay Feature Team will begin work 2022-09-29
    x1 Engineering dev with 10 tasks (128% load)

Please note that not all removals are intentional; there is currently a bug with how time is entered on the Progress Tracker that can cause deliverables to disappear.

entry.title: Scheduled Deliverables - 2022-06-08
entry.content:
Scheduled Deliverables

as of 2022-06-08

There are currently 87 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 43 teams

7 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 4 team(s) within two weeks

This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments.

The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again.

The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable.

extra analysis (click me)


There are approximately 396 devs (out of ~512, or 77%) with 864 assignments scheduled to work on 87 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 24% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~180 devs (35%) scheduled for approximately 2036 man-days. 31% of deliverables are shared between both projects.

15 deliverable(s) are not currently scheduled to continue work after this sprint:
  • AI - Arcade Machine
  • AI - Untrained Combat
  • AI - Usable System V2
  • Animatable Gunner Helmet
  • Audio to Animation Toolset
  • Drake Mule
  • Enemy Characters

  • Gen12 - Renderer T1
  • MISC Hull C
  • Physical Damage & Breakability
  • Physics - Ropes Simulation
  • RSI Scorpius
  • Subsumption Editor Integration
  • Unannounced Vehicle

entry.summary: Scheduled Deliverables as of 2022-06-08 There are currently 87 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 43 teams 7 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 4 team(s) within two weeks This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments. The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again. The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable. extra analysis (click me) There are approximately 396 devs (out of ~512, or 77%) with 864 assignments scheduled to work on 87 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 24% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~180 devs (35%) scheduled for approximately 2036 man-days. 31% of deliverables are shared between both projects. 15 deliverable(s) are not currently scheduled to continue work after this sprint: AI - Arcade Machine AI - Untrained Combat AI - Usable System V2 Animatable Gunner Helmet Audio to Animation Toolset Drake Mule Enemy Characters Frontier Clothing Gen12 - Renderer T1 MISC Hull C Physical Damage & Breakability Physics - Ropes Simulation RSI Scorpius Subsumption Editor Integration Unannounced Vehicle Below are the time breakdowns for each team: Actor Feature Team38% part-time with 165 task(s) scheduled, 46% of which are for SQ42 Actor Tech Team42% part-time with 60 task(s) scheduled, 38% of which are for SQ42 AI entry.title: Progress Tracker Delta - 2022-05-25
entry.content:
Progress Tracker Delta

455 deliverables listed | 2022-05-11 => 2022-05-25

There were 3 modifications, 1 removals, and 0 additions in this update. Please note that not all removals are intentional; there is currently a bug with how time is entered on the Progress Tracker that can cause deliverables to disappear.

extra analysis (click me)


There are approximately 486 devs (out of ~512, or 95%) with 1051 assignments scheduled to work on 145 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 5% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~204 devs (40%) scheduled for approximately 1983 man-days. 10% of deliverables are shared between both projects.

entry.title: Scheduled Deliverables - 2022-05-25
entry.content:
Scheduled Deliverables

as of 2022-05-25

There are currently 99 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 45 teams

13 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 11 team(s) within two weeks

This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments.

The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again.

The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable.

extra analysis (click me)


There are approximately 434 devs (out of ~512, or 85%) with 939 assignments scheduled to work on 99 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 21% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~198 devs (39%) scheduled for approximately 1911 man-days. 33% of deliverables are shared between both projects.

17 deliverable(s) are not currently scheduled to continue work after this sprint:
  • AI - Arcade Machine
  • AI - Navigation Links - Ladders/Ledge Grab

  • Turret Usability Improvements
  • VisArea Improvements

    full-time with 26 task(s) scheduled, 40% of which are for SQ42

    89% part-time with 166 task(s) scheduled, all of which are for SQ42
  • Editor Team
    full-time with 12 task(s) scheduled, 50% of which are for SQ42

    46% part-time with 28 task(s) scheduled, 50% of which are for SQ42
  • EU Landing Zone Team
    full-time with 17 task(s) scheduled, 40% of which are for SQ42
  • EU Sandbox 1
    full-time with 20 task(s) scheduled, 50% of which are for SQ42
  • Facial Animation

entry.summary: Scheduled Deliverables as of 2022-05-25 There are currently 99 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 45 teams 13 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 11 team(s) within two weeks This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments. The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again. The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable. extra analysis (click me) There are approximately 434 devs (out of ~512, or 85%) with 939 assignments scheduled to work on 99 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 21% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~198 devs (39%) scheduled for approximately 1911 man-days. 33% of deliverables are shared between both projects. 17 deliverable(s) are not currently scheduled to continue work after this sprint: AI - Arcade Machine AI - Navigation Links - Ladders/Ledge Grab AI - Untrained Combat AI - Usable System V2 Chapter 08 ECUS Improvements Fire entry.title: Progress Tracker Delta - 2022-05-11
entry.content:
Progress Tracker Delta

456 deliverables listed | 2022-04-27 => 2022-05-11

There were 45 modifications, 0 removals, and 0 additions in this update. Please note that not all removals are intentional; there is currently a bug with how time is entered on the Progress Tracker that can cause deliverables to disappear.

extra analysis (click me)


There are approximately 534 devs (out of ~512, or 104%) with 1161 assignments scheduled to work on 159 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 5% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~228 devs (45%) scheduled for approximately 4941 man-days. 11% of deliverables are shared between both projects.

On average, the schedule has expanded by 8 days. 8 deliverables were not extended:
  • AI - Planetary Navigation
  • Atlas
  • Character Creator
  • Greycat Industrial Salvage Backpack
  • MISC Odyssey
  • Move Planet to Compute
  • Probability Volume Encounter Density Refactor
  • Security Behavior

entry.title: Scheduled Deliverables - 2022-05-11
entry.content:
Scheduled Deliverables

as of 2022-05-11

There are currently 102 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 45 teams

20 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 13 team(s) within two weeks

This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments.

The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again.

The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable.

extra analysis (click me)


There are approximately 468 devs (out of ~512, or 91%) with 1013 assignments scheduled to work on 102 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 20% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~202 devs (39%) scheduled for approximately 2446 man-days. 32% of deliverables are shared between both projects.

17 deliverable(s) are not currently scheduled to continue work after this sprint:
  • AI - Landing Improvements
  • AI - Navigation Links - Ladders/Ledge Grab
  • Chapter 09

entry.summary: Scheduled Deliverables as of 2022-05-11 There are currently 102 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 45 teams 20 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 13 team(s) within two weeks This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments. The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again. The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable. extra analysis (click me) There are approximately 468 devs (out of ~512, or 91%) with 1013 assignments scheduled to work on 102 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 20% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~202 devs (39%) scheduled for approximately 2446 man-days. 32% of deliverables are shared between both projects. 17 deliverable(s) are not currently scheduled to continue work after this sprint: AI - Landing Improvements AI - Navigation Links - Ladders/Ledge Grab Chapter 09 Civilian NPC Movement Improvements Doors/Airlocks/Light Panels entry.title: Progress Tracker Delta - 2022-04-27
entry.content:
Progress Tracker Delta

456 deliverables listed | 2022-04-13 => 2022-04-27

There were 50 modifications, 1 removals, and 4 additions in this update. Please note that not all removals are intentional; there is currently a bug with how time is entered on the Progress Tracker that can cause deliverables to disappear.

extra analysis (click me)


There are approximately 492 devs (out of ~512, or 96%) with 1074 assignments scheduled to work on 153 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 5% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~162 devs (32%) scheduled for approximately 2327 man-days. 10% of deliverables are shared between both projects.

On average, the schedule has expanded by 7 days. 5 deliverables were not extended:
  • Asset Reference Database
  • Chapter 21
  • Greycat Industrial Cydnus Mining Droid
  • Greycat Industrial Salvage Tool
  • Greycat Industrial Tractor Tool

entry.title: Scheduled Deliverables - 2022-04-27
entry.content:
Scheduled Deliverables

as of 2022-04-27

There are currently 90 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 38 teams

14 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 13 team(s) within two weeks

This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments.

The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again.

The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable.

extra analysis (click me)


There are approximately 416 devs (out of ~512, or 81%) with 909 assignments scheduled to work on 90 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 21% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~134 devs (26%) scheduled for approximately 1753 man-days. 27% of deliverables are shared between both projects.

5 deliverable(s) are not currently scheduled to continue work after this sprint:
  • Atlas
  • Greycat Industrial Salvage Backpack
  • MISC Odyssey
  • Probability Volume Encounter Density Refactor
  • Unannounced Vehicle

entry.summary: Scheduled Deliverables as of 2022-04-27 There are currently 90 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 38 teams 14 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 13 team(s) within two weeks This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments. The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again. The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable. extra analysis (click me) There are approximately 416 devs (out of ~512, or 81%) with 909 assignments scheduled to work on 90 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 21% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~134 devs (26%) scheduled for approximately 1753 man-days. 27% of deliverables are shared between both projects. 5 deliverable(s) are not entry.title: Progress Tracker Delta - 2022-04-13
entry.content:
Progress Tracker Delta

453 deliverables listed | 2022-03-30 => 2022-04-13

There were 90 modifications, 0 removals, and 6 additions in this update. Please note that not all removals are intentional; there is currently a bug with how time is entered on the Progress Tracker that can cause deliverables to disappear.

extra analysis (click me)


There are approximately 487 devs (out of ~512, or 95%) with 1056 assignments scheduled to work on 155 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 6% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~159 devs (31%) scheduled for approximately 2909 man-days. 9% of deliverables are shared between both projects.

On average, the schedule has expanded by 37 days. 2 deliverables were not extended:
  • Chapter 07
  • Reputation V2

Mantle T2

2022-05-15 => 2022-07-07
Improving the existing mantling feature, including mantling up to a surface without a wall to push up against, jumping over a gap to reach a mantle, and overall improved detection radius.

The following team(s) were assigned:

  • Actor Feature Team will begin work 2022-05-15
    x1 Engineering dev with 3 tasks (89% load)

microTech Lagrange Points

2022-04-01 => 2022-05-19
Implementing additional reststop locations surrounding microTech, including both the stations themselves and the gas clouds surrounding them.

The following team(s) were assigned:

  • EU Sandbox 1 began work 2022-04-01
    x1 Art dev with 1 tasks (49% load)
  • Lighting Team will begin work 2022-04-24
    x1 Art dev with 2 tasks (152% load)

Seated Item Handling

2022-09-29 => 2022-12-30
This feature will add the ability for players and NPCs to use items or smaller weapons while seated in a passenger seat of a vehicle or ship.

The following team(s) were assigned:

  • Actor Feature Team will begin work 2022-09-29
    x2 Animation devs with 12 tasks (57% load)

Sliding

2022-09-29 => 2022-12-30

Please note that not all removals are intentional; there is currently a bug with how time is entered on the Progress Tracker that can cause deliverables to disappear.

entry.title: Scheduled Deliverables - 2022-04-13
entry.content:
Scheduled Deliverables

as of 2022-04-13

There are currently 91 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 38 teams

9 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 6 team(s) within two weeks

This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments.

The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again.

The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable.

extra analysis (click me)


There are approximately 405 devs (out of ~512, or 79%) with 888 assignments scheduled to work on 91 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 20% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~121 devs (24%) scheduled for approximately 1075 man-days. 25% of deliverables are shared between both projects.

3 deliverable(s) are not currently scheduled to continue work after this sprint:
  • Chapter 21
  • Greycat Industrial Salvage Tool
  • Greycat Industrial Tractor Tool

entry.summary: Scheduled Deliverables as of 2022-04-13 There are currently 91 scheduled deliverables being worked on by 38 teams 9 deliverables are scheduled to begin work by 6 team(s) within two weeks This report lists the actively assigned deliverables and the associated teams, along with the number of developers assigned to each time period. Deliverable time allocations are often staggered over their total lifespan and have multiple devs in the same department working in parallel, but their allocations are obviously not going to be equal. For a better look at this, clicking the team name (or one of the completion dates listed below it) will display a rendering of the current waterfall chart iteration. This chart provides an overview of the schedule breakdown of each team in week long segments. The timeslots you see on the RSI website are actually fragmented into many smaller sections, usually two week sprints. I do my best to combine relevant timespans by looking for overlaps (4 days currently). If a team says they end earlier than you expect, it means that there is some sizeable period of time between then and the next time they start working on the deliverable again. The load calculation is an approximation based on the sum of the part-time and full-time tasks (averaged at 80 hours to complete a piece) divided by the team capacity (with a focus factor of 60%) over the given time period. Without exact hourly estimates for each task, a more accurate assessment doesn’t seem likely, so interpret the load as a given dev group’s general utilization on a deliverable. extra analysis (click me) There are approximately 405 devs (out of ~512, or 79%) with 888 assignments scheduled to work on 91 observable deliverables. Of those deliverables, 20% are for SQ42 exclusively, with ~121 devs (24%) scheduled for approximately 1075 man-days. 25% of deliverables are shared between both projects. 3 deliverable(s) are not
